etymologies: late Middle English (in polyp (sense 2)): from Old French polipe, from Latin polypus (see polypus). polyp (sense 1) dates from the mid 18th century

definitions: a solitary or colonial sedentary form of a coelenterate such as a sea anemone, typically having a columnar body with the mouth uppermost surrounded by a ring of tentacles. In some species, polyps are a phase in the life cycle which alternates with a medusoid phase.
shortDefinitions: solitary or colonial sedentary form of coelenterate such as sea anemone

definitions: a small growth, usually benign and with a stalk, protruding from a mucous membrane.
shortDefinitions: small growth protruding from mucous membrane
